body.name: Mejiao 4 Pack (2) 6" & (2) 8" Electric Stove Burner Covers, Drip Pan Set Replacement for GE/Hotpoint WB31T10010 and WB31T10011
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 3 hrs 19 mins
features: Update your stove: Affordable solution to upgrade your stove top with our outstanding craft drip pans. The brilliant chrome surface adds a great shine and will make your stove look brand new.

More durable stainless steel: Our drip pans are made of high quality stainless steel, which is stronger and more durable than other materials, effectively reducing bending and curling, and serving longer.
Save time and energy：Excellent energy gathering effect of these pans, which reduce temperature loss during cooking. Plus, the large size of the bottom catches spills and prevents hazards.
Easy to Clean: Our oven burner drip pans are easy to clean up when they become dirty. You can even put them in your dishwasher for hassle-free cleaning.

Perfect fit:Includes 2 x 6" and 2 x 8" pans. Compatible with GE/Hotpoint WB31T10010 and WB31T10011 and fits plug-in electric ranges such as Camco, GE, Hotpoint, Kenmore models of 1995-2003, Moffat, Monogram (GE), Profile (GE), RCA (GE), and Roper models prior to 1996.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well made product, great shipping
reviews.reviewText: These drip pans were a perfect fit for my GE stove-top. They are nicely manufactured and the finish on the metal is less shiny than the chrome drip pans, which is what I wanted. They were very well packaged and padded and arrived quickly and in perfect condition. Very pleased with the purchase, especially as stainless steel drip pans are not easy to find and typically more expensive than these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not too bad.
reviews.reviewText: Bought these to replace the old ones in my apartment. They feel kind of thin, but I rent. Overall they fit fine and look good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality and value!
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for its purpose at a great price point!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does it’s job

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Stainless steel, but not OEM specs
reviews.reviewText: I bought this set of drip bowls for a GE cooktop (Model JP328). While the bowls are stainless steel, the gauge of metal is much thinner than with the factory original bowls. The rims of the 8 inch bowls were bent when I opened the plastic bag the set was shipped in, but the rims were easy to bend back.The rims of both the 8 inch and 6 inch bowls have lower profiles than the factory original bowls. This means the surface units (burners) sit lower than before. That's OK for the 6 inch bowls on my cooktop, but it was a problem for one of the 8 inch bowls where, at first, the surface unit did not sit level in the bowl. I eventually fixed the problem by bending the rim of the bowl so the rim was even all the way around.Since they're stainless steel, I'll keep the bowls. However, had I known how thin the metal was, I would have bought something else.

reviews.reviewText: Sure beats cleaning the old ones
